title: Kansas City, Kansas
summary: Kansas City, abbreviated as "KCK", is the third-largest city in the U.S. state of Kansas, the county seat of Wyandotte County, and the third-largest city of the Kansas City metropolitan area.[1]  As of the 2020 census, the population of the city was 156,607.[3]  The city formed as a streetcar suburb of Kansas City, Missouri, after which it is named.[4][5] It is situated at Kaw Point, the junction of the Missouri and Kansas rivers. It is part of a consolidated city-county government known as the "Unified Government". Wyandotte County also includes the independent cities of Bonner Springs, Edwardsville, a portion of Lake Quivira, and the unincorporated area known as Loring.
